chargeHist.descr: Strangulation and Suffocation (with a Previous Conviction)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Paul M Wasyliw in court, in custody via video.  Attorney Conner Helvig in court for Paul M Wasyliw.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense waiting on ruling from revocation decision. Discovery received. Motion to modify bond by defense, State objects. Argument. Victim is asking for bond to be modified. Court reduces bond but does not lift the no contact. Bond adjusted down to $2000 cash. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt:
3:00 PM (64-06) Defendant Paul M Wasyliw appeared by video.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Conner Helvig in court for Paul M Wasyliw. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Helvig acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty on all charges on behalf of the defendant.

Victim in court, no statement.

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Paul M Wasyliw in court, in custody.  Attorney Conner Helvig in court for Paul M Wasyliw. Bond remains. Victim is present and asking for contact. State objects to modifying contact. Defendant on PO hold. Court denies bond motion. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested. Time period waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 228862,
Payable Number: 265957,
Receipt Number: 22R 013245,
Amount: $20.00
Victim's Request to Lift the No Contact
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant Paul M Wasyliw in court, in custody.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. Atttorney Jason Danne appears specially for the public defender's office. Called at 2:02 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance. Record by ATty. Daane that the Public Defender's Office has not yet appointed counsel and asks for two (2) weeks. Court grants.
Victim is present in Court and makes a request to have no contact amended to no violent contact. Objection by the State. Response by Atty. Daane who asks that phone contact be allowed while he is in custody. State still objects. 

Court will modify the no contact to no violent contact while the Defendant is in custody ONLY.  No discussion about the case, no intimidation or harrassment of victim. If defendant is released from custody the prior no contact remains in full effect with NO CONTACT allowed until process of lifting no contact is completed.
Court in recess
Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

**AMENDED 9/26/2022: BOND ADJUSTED DOWN TO $2000 CASH. DEFENDANT MAY HAVE TEXT CONVERSATION WITH VICTIM BUT NO TALKING OR IN PERSON CONTACT.
*AMENDMENT 7-5-2022: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WHILE DEFENDANT IS IN CUSTODY. No discussion about the case, no intimidation or harrassment of victim allowed. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.C.L. dob 10-29-1978 or RESIDENCE. COURT ORDERS NO CONTACT UNDER CH. 940.  If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Paul M Wasyliw in court, in custody by video. James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Obi Uzowulu appeared specially. Victim is present and addresses court. Defendant is on PO hold. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Arrest
